attributes.action: Save Sir Hawkey Hall Woodford Green, demand public consultation.75 years service
attributes.additional_details:
The Sir James Hawkey Hall, Woodford Green will be demolished as part of Redbridge Council’s plans to create a new community facility.
http://m.guardian-series.co.uk/news/14239841.Hawkey_Hall_to_be_demolished_after_75_years_of_public_service/
Sir Winston Churchill opened the Hall, we must not let the dreams of modern men crush the memories of the generation that fought for their liberty!
http://www.20thcenturylondon.org.uk/redls-493
attributes.background: A well-loved community hall is to be demolished after 75 years of serving the public. Sir Winston Churchill opened the Hall, we must not let the dreams of modern men crush the memories of the generation that fought for their liberty! This building holds architectural history which must be preserved.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This issue is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:
http://www2.redbridge.gov.uk/cms/the_council/about_the_council/e-petitions_and_petitions.aspx
